channel.title: Organ music of the centuries
channel.description:
Highlights of noted organ music selections from various periods, including Pre-Baroque and Baroque; Classical and Romantic; and Modern.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part nine
item.description: This program features more performances of organ compositions by Johann Sebastian Bach.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Bach, Johann Sebastian, 1685-1750. Organ music.

item.title: Romantic era
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Cesar Franck; Louis Vierne; Joseph Jongen; and Max Reger.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Franck, Ce_sar, 1822-1890. Organ music

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part ten
item.description: This program features performances of organ compositions by J.S. Bach and George Handel.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Bach, Johann Sebastian, 1685-1750. Organ music.

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part eleven
item.description: This program features more performances of organ compositions by Johann Sebastian Bach.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Bach, Johann Sebastian, 1685-1750. Organ music.

item.title: Classical and Romantic organ music, part one
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart; Samuel Wesley; and Felix Mendelssohn.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Mendelssohn-Bartholdy, Felix, 1809-1847. Organ music

item.title: Classical and Romantic organ music, part seven
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Johannes Brahms; Louis Vierne; and Cesar Franck.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Franck, Ce_sar, 1822-1890. Organ music

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part one
item.description: The first of several programs looking at Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music features discussion and performance of organ compositions by Marcello, Sweelinck, Walther, and Pachelbel.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Pachelbel, Johann, 1653-1706. Organ music

item.dc:subject: Organists--France.

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part four

item.dc:subject: Bach, Johann Sebastian, 1685-1750. Organ music.

item.title: Modern organ music, part four
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Eric Delamarter; Ralph Vaughan Williams; and Joseph Jongen.

item.dc:subject: Vaughan Williams, Ralph, 1872-1958.

item.dc:subject: Dupre_, Marcel, 1886-1971. Organ music. Selections

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part three
item.description: This program features performances of organ compositions by Byrd; Henry Purcell; Daquin; Couperin; Clerembault; Johan Pachelbel; and Dieterich Buxtehude.

item.dc:subject: Pachelbel, Johann, 1653-1706. Organ music
